newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber closes little changed in thin volume.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber closes little changed in thin volume.

text.p: CME lumber futures closed little changed in thin trade, underpinned by news of labor unrest in Canada.

A strike began on Monday as scheduled at three Fletcher Challenge Canada Ltd mills in British Columbia. Both sides in the dispute have said they were settling in for a strike lasting at least a month.

Dealers said volume featured light rolling forward of positions out of the July contract into September at around $8.00 but rollover volume was much lighter than normal since the spot month is due to expire Tuesday.
Cash lumber was reported to be steady at $359.00 per tbf after prices weakened last week.
September closed off $1.50 per tbf at $367.30.
